text: Christoph Junghans is a German computational physicist and academic, working in multiscale modeling and computational co-design. He is currently the deputy group leader of the applied computer science group at Los Alamos National Laboratory. == Career == Born in Merseburg, he was educated at Leipzig University and the Johannes Gutenberg University Mainz (PhD, 2010). During his graduate studies he also worked at Forschungszentrum Jülich and the IBM Systems & Technology Group. Junghans joined Los Alamos National Laboratory in 2011 as a PostDoc of theoretical division and became a staff member with the applied computer science group in 2014. Junghans is one of the authors of the VOTCA package and a contributor to many open-sources projects including Gromacs and Gentoo Linux. ==References== Category:1982 births Category:Living people Category:Leipzig University alumni Category:Johannes Gutenberg University Mainz alumni Category:Max Planck Institute for Polymer Research alumni Category:Max Planck Society alumni Category:Los Alamos National Laboratory personnel Category:Gentoo Linux people Category:People from Merseburg
title: Christoph Junghans
